continuous:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«exprâŸª , âŸ«Â» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«exprâŸª , âŸ«Â» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `Â«expr â†’â‚—[ ] Â» -/
/-- The **Hellinger--Toeplitz theorem**: if a symmetric operator is defined on a complete space,
  then it is automatically continuous. -/
theorem is_symmetric.continuous [complete_space E] {T : Â«expr â†’â‚—[ ] Â» E ğ•œ E} (hT : is_symmetric T) : continuous T :=
  by
  -- We prove it by using the closed graph theorem
  refine' T.continuous_of_seq_closed_graph fun u x y hu hTu => _
  rw [â† sub_eq_zero, â† inner_self_eq_zero]
  have hlhs : âˆ€ k : â„•, Â«exprâŸª , âŸ«Â» (T (u k) - T x) (y - T x) = Â«exprâŸª , âŸ«Â» (u k - x) (T (y - T x)) :=
    by
    intro k
    rw [â† T.map_sub, hT]
  refine' tendsto_nhds_unique ((hTu.sub_const _).inner tendsto_const_nhds) _
  simp_rw [hlhs]
  rw [â† @inner_zero_left ğ•œ E _ _ (T (y - T x))]
  refine' filter.tendsto.inner _ tendsto_const_nhds
  rw [â† sub_self x]
  exact hu.sub_const _
#align is_symmetric.continuous is_symmetric.continuous
